What is the experimental procedure for forming pale yellow prismatic crystals of succinatodisilver(1)?
data.answer: A sodium silicate solution is slowly added to an aqueous solution of succinic acid until the pH reaches 5.6, followed by the addition of an aqueous solution of AgNO3.

data.question: How does the structure of succinatodisilver(1) differ from that of malonatodisilver(1)?
data.answer: Succinatodisilver(1) forms a highly unusual crystal structure with planar tetranuclear silver clusters bridged by succinate anions, while malonatodisilver(1) is polymeric but has a completely different structure.
